I really enjoy this games it gives you a lot of different challenges and keeps you focused it’s a great time passer, But one problem I always seem to have  is the Starvation problem in my islands no matter how many farms,markets,or restaurants I add once my population goes over 100 citizens starvations starts to become a problem 

I thinking this problem could be solved by adding a system to manually manage how much you export or even import. This could also be an easier way to manage your economy since you’ll have control of how much you export 

As a cool feature you can add a building (a World Trade Center or something) that you have to buy in order to unlock the export/import management system

title.label: Crashes More Than My Blind Asian Grandma

content.label:
Excellent mobile adaptation to this incredibly addictive game. Takes a full day to complete each of the challenging scenarios (game includes 25 scenarios). Beautiful graphics and amazing engine we all expect from the original. 

THEN AGAIN, see the title of my review. Never had a game crash so much. So frustrating.

title.label: So glad we finally got an iPhone app!

content.label:
I’m an old school Tropico player. I loved the first game and didn’t “need all that fancy graphic stuff”. 
That being said, gameplay is still essentially the same and I can sneak and play this when my kids are playing—which was a lot harder to do on the PC or Xbox. 

Too much to ask for a Tropico Paradise Island release? Eh. I tried!

Thanks for being awesome!

To start off this is a great game, The graphics are phenomenal and the details, don't even get me started they are soo good there is a literal donkey that moves in the teamster's office, that just goes to show that they put tiny details that no one might see but still put them there! But as with any great game, there are some things that can be added, the first being... Moving buildings! it may just be me but I can not move them and it would be so good to be able to! The second, mods! it would nice to be able to add mods to the game so that other ideas can be put in, the last thing I would like to see added is... more buildings and variations! such as more docks, airports, skyscrapers, shopping centers, and vehicles Ect. I hope you like my ideas please consider them,

              -bye :)
You people are stupid this game is trash why would you play it play something better than this dumb game I can’t keep up with anything everything needs to slow down or I can’t play this game no more.
I haven’t even been able to play so really 0 stars.  Sent in report and email but no response.  Hopefully I can get a refund.
Game lags so hard and barely can function wish I never brought it thought it was goin to be good end up being trash
Great game but I haven’t been able to play it because the game constantly keeps crashing on me.
I would give it 5 stars if it wasn’t for the constant crashes, I keep loosing what took me a while to build and it takes the fun of it.

I loved the pc version so gave this a try. And I will tell you now this is the most underrated game in the App Store. I’m a huge strategy game player and this is the number 1 strategy game in the market. O and the visuals are mind blowing. 

Only problem I have is I can’t put it down.

I played PC versions of this game for years, and it was always a favorite. When I bought the app, I was excited but not especially hopeful that it would match my previous experience. I could not have been more wrong!

The game is the same challenging city-builder/strategy simulation it was before, but the attention to detail, the shockingly beautiful graphic production, the intuitive controls just make this a must-have. I’d have payed five times the price for this game and called it a bargain. Viva Presidente!

I was looking for strategy games and this was one of the best strategy building games and was very highly rated. It is very fun but it does take a while to get a handle on all the controls and how to manage the budget. 
My main tip is if your between Total war and Tropico, Total War is more hands on and has strategic battles but Tropico is much more detailed on how to actually run a civilization.

Before I mention the flaw, let me say that this is an awesome mobile game and well worth the $12 I spent on it. There’s just one thing missing that’s in the real Tropico 4-6 game that makes it fail to get 5*, and that is imports/trade routes!!

In Tropico for PC you can make something similar to the US economy where you rely heavily on imports. Import food and metals and lumber etc, then turn right around and sell the final products for a profit. It’s hard to do, but it’s very possible. Just a natural end game progression of your island.

Because this is gone, there’s only one real route to success.. you have to be able to produce the raw input materials on your island. Maybe hace a factory that can up the value of those materials, then export, export, export!

Another flaw might be in the time limit, but we will see!

content.label: I played the game for a few days with no problems, until for the past two days I can’t even get to the main menu without the game crashing. I have the latest iPad, it just keeps on crashing. Would love to rate it higher, it’s a fantastic game, bit it needs to be more stable.

Couldn’t download or get a refund

UPDATE!:

My iOS must have been bewitched or haunted (All Hallows Eve is coming after all...!) After deleting/reinstalling the app twice with no change. Rebooting my iPad numerous times, nothing made any difference. It was like I was trying to run Tropico on an old, underpowered, home built PC. I intended on deleting Tropico and forgot too. The next day (?) I saw Tropic’s icon and was ready to remove it. I decided to try it one last time. Everything is working perfectly! Not asking any questions, only playing! I started around 11pm and the next thing I knew, it was 4:30am! LOL. World building should be so easy in the SimCity app.

—————-
First startup, after the Kalypso graphics, just a black screen with music. 

Restart game and get further but the graphics freezes and the music keeps playing. 

The third attempt to play Tropico the graphics stutters and freezes like the old PC days but keeps moving on. The graphics are fuzzy, like looking through a haze of smoke. Tutorial is buggy. Says, select a citizen. It took almost 5 minutes to find anyone. Then it turns night and is raining. Can’t find anybody again. Finally, I find a woman. Select her and then the Tutorial says to select “?”. Nothing. Tried again, no response. Thank you for bringing the PC problems with the game’s port to iOS. I am using the 1st Gen iPad Pro on iOS 12.3.1.
I’m deleted Tropico as it is just plain terribly and wastes 2.5GB of memory! I’ll try and get a refund from Apple.
